translation.en: [woman] This is my diary.
I'm reading you the excerpt from December 12, 1978.
So, it says, "Today was an absolute miserable day."
"Rob never came home last night."
"He never got back to the store, and he never went home."
[woman] When I was about 15,
I started working at Nisson Pharmacy.
I was a clerk. I was the person at the front and ran the cash register.
translation.ko: 앞에 앉아 계산을 담당하는 점원이었죠 "킴 바이어스룬드 박사 로버트 피스트의 친구"

translation.en: I met Rob Piest when he came to work at the pharmacy.
translation.ko: 로버트 피스트와 만난 건 그 애가 약국에 일하러 왔을 때예요

translation.en: He was the new stock boy.
He did sports.
He was a gymnast.
And he had outdoor interests, um, in hiking, and he was a photographer.
He was actually working there to save money for a camera and a car.
translation.ko: 약국에서 일한 것도 카메라와 차를 사기 위해서였고

translation.en: He was very close with his family.
He loved his family and he talked about 'em a lot.
translation.ko: 가족을 좋아해서 가족 얘기도 많이 했죠

translation.en: I remember when I came to work on December 11.
In December in Chicago, it is freezing.
And the cash register was right at the front of the door,
and people were in and out a lot, and I would get cold.
And so, Rob had a very nice, uh, blue down jacket.
translation.ko: 그날 로버트가 예쁜 파란색 오리털 재킷을 입고 왔길래

translation.en: So I asked him if I could borrow it and wear it at the front while I was working the cash register.
translation.ko: 전 계산대에서 일할 동안 빌려 입어도 되냐고 물어봤어요

translation.en: There was a man, a middle-aged man in, you know, a flannel shirt
walking around the store.
I asked the pharmacist and he said, oh, he was a contractor
who was there because they were thinking about doing some remodeling in the store.
translation.ko: 가게 리모델링을 할까 싶어서 불렀다고 하더군요

translation.en: As the night was winding down,
Rob came back to the front of the counter and said, "Hey, can I have my jacket back?"
"I'm gonna go outside and talk to that contractor about a job."
translation.ko: 나가서 건설업자와 일자리 얘기를 할 거라더군요

translation.en: And then he put his jacket on and he went outside.
[Byers-Lund] And then, you know, the store stayed busy.
So I kind of lost track of time
and the fact that, you know, we were getting ready to close.
And his mom came in and wanted to know where he was.
translation.ko: 로버트의 엄마가 와서 로버트가 어디 있는지 물었어요

translation.en: And I asked her, I said, "He's outside talking to some contractor about a job."
translation.ko: 전 밖에서 건설업자와 일자리 얘기 중이라고 대답했어요

translation.en: And she said, no, he… she didn't see him out there.
So she said, "Tell him just call me when he gets back,
translation.ko: 로버트가 오면 집에 전화하라고 전해 달라더군요

translation.en: and I will come over and pick him up."
And so, when the final closing was at 10:00,
um, his mom had called and said, "Is he back yet?"
And I said, "No. He's not here at all."
I knew that that night was Rob's mom's birthday.
That's why she waited for a while,
'cause they had a birthday celebration planned for that night.
Rob would never have missed his mom's birthday.
translation.ko: 로버트는 엄마 생신에 빠질 애가 절대 아니었어요

translation.en: He was missing.
[Gacy] First of all, drop that "Mr. Gacy" thing.
[investigator] Okay, John. That was technical.
translation.ko: 알았어요, 존 형식상 그렇게 부른 거예요

translation.en: [Gacy] I don't know who the hell you're talking to. Just John.
translation.ko: 누굴 부르는 건지 모르겠어요 그냥 존이라고 해요

translation.en: [investigator] Okay, John. Go ahead.
[Gacy] John, or JW, or whatever the hell else they call me,
translation.ko: 존이나 JW 말고 다른 이름으로 부른다면

translation.en: or whatever else comes to your mind if I get too mad.
translation.ko: 내가 화나서 무슨 짓을 할지 몰라요

translation.en: [Gacy] Nobody wants to accept what the hell I say.
translation.ko: 아무도 내 말을 믿으려 하지 않아요

translation.en: Because what I tell you is… is what I know as fact.
I have nothing to gain. I have nothing to lose by telling you something that's not the truth.
translation.ko: 거짓말해 봤자 얻을 것도, 잃을 것도 없어요

translation.en: But I'm getting to the point that I keep going over and over and over every fucking thing.
translation.ko: 빌어먹을 같은 말을 계속해서 반복하고 있는데

translation.en: But I'm at the breaking point with it.
I don't… I don't know how much more of this shit I can take.
translation.ko: 이 꼴을 얼마나 더 버틸 수 있을지 모르겠어요

translation.en: -[investigator] What do you think happen-- -[Gacy] I don't know. I… I don't.
translation.ko: - 대체 무슨 일이… - 난 몰라요, 몰라

translation.en: [man] 1978. I had just left the Public Defender's Office.
translation.ko: 1978년은 제가 국선 변호인을 갓 관둔 때였어요

translation.en: I decided to go into private practice.
Sitting in my new office and, uh, I get a telephone call.
translation.ko: 새 사무실에 앉아 있는데 "샘 아미란테 게이시의 형사 변호사" 전화가 한 통 왔어요

translation.en: [Amirante] I said, "Law office." He said, "Hi, Sam. This is John Gacy."
I said, "Hi, John, how are you?" He said, "Can you do me a favor?"
translation.ko: 전 안부를 물었고 존이 부탁이 있다고 했어요

translation.en: I said, "Sure. What do you need?"
"Find out why I'm being tailed by the Des Plaines police." "No problem."
translation.ko: 왜 데스플레인스 경찰이 미행하는지 알아봐 달라더군요 전 알아보겠다고 했죠

translation.en: [Sam] I had been Chief Public Defender in Des Plaines, where this was going on.
translation.ko: 저는 존이 말한 데스플레인스에서 국선 변호인으로 있었어요

translation.en: I knew all those guys over there. I know the chief, I know the mayor.
translation.ko: 경찰서장, 시장 할 것 없이 그곳 사람들은 다 알고 지냈죠

translation.en: I'll… I'll find out. I'll ask some questions, I'll ask around.
And so, my first client in my private practice was John Gacy.
translation.ko: 그러니까 개인 변호사가 된 후 첫 의뢰인이 존 게이시였던 거죠

translation.en: You know, everybody from the neighborhood,
from the northwest suburbs of Chicago knew John Gacy.
He had a construction business called Painting, Decorating and Maintenance.
translation.ko: 존은 '페인트칠, 장식, 보수'라는 건설 회사를 운영했어요

translation.en: He was also a Democratic Precinct Captain
in the Cook County Democratic Organization.
Precinct Captains take care of the people in the neighborhood.
translation.ko: 선거구 지부장은 주민들을 돌보는 일을 해요

translation.en: So if somebody needed a garbage can, or somebody needed a bulb changed,
translation.ko: 누가 쓰레기통이 필요하거나 전구를 갈아야 하거나

translation.en: or somebody needed their driveway shoveled, or something,
translation.ko: 차고 진입로의 눈을 치워야 할 때

translation.en: the Precinct Captain would be there to help them.
Gacy was the best Precinct Captain
in the Norwood Park Democratic Organization.
Everybody knew him.
I got active in the Democratic Party because I wanted to get into politics someday.
translation.ko: 전 언젠가 정계에 진출하고 싶어서 민주당 활동을 했는데

translation.en: And so, I knew him through doing that.
He called me because he thought I had influence.
translation.ko: 존은 제가 그곳에 영향력이 있어서 전화한 거였어요

translation.en: Not because he thought I was a great lawyer. He thought I had clout.
translation.ko: 제가 실력 좋은 변호사라서가 아니라 영향력이 있다고 생각했기 때문이죠

translation.en: So the first thing I did was go to the police.
"Hey, John Gacy's a good guy. What are you guys following him for?"
translation.ko: 존 게이시는 선량한 사람인데 왜 미행하느냐고 물었죠

translation.en: They'd say, "There's a missing kid. We think he has something to do with it."
translation.ko: 아이가 실종됐는데 존이 연관된 것 같다더군요

translation.en: I'd be like, "You're crazy, a missing kid. You obviously have the wrong guy."
translation.ko: 전 말도 안 된다며 애먼 사람을 잡는 거라고 했죠

translation.en: [man 1] I was assigned to the Piest case the day after he disappeared.
translation.ko: 로버트 피스트가 실종된 다음 날 사건을 맡았어요

translation.en: Rob Piest had a part-time job at Nisson Drugs.
translation.ko: 로버트 피스트는 니슨 약국에서 아르바이트를 했는데 "라파엘 토바르 데스플레인스 경찰서"

translation.en: It was on Touhy Avenue in Des Plaines.
A missing persons report was filed by the Piest family.
translation.ko: "실종 사건 신고서 피스트, 로버트" 실종 신고는 로버트의 가족들이 했어요 "최종 목격일 1978년 12월 11일"

translation.en: They were in shock, I believe,
because this is just so unlike the young man to disappear.
When Mr. and Mrs. Piest came into the office,
uh, they were… uh, distraught, completely.
translation.ko: "테리 설리번 쿡 카운티 검사" 완전히 넋이 나가 있었습니다

translation.en: They had been out all night searching for Rob.
We talked, and they convinced me in about a minute,
translation.ko: 두 분과 대화하고 곧장 확신이 들었어요

translation.en: that, in fact, uh, we had something more than a runaway on our hands.
And that's really what led our office, that is the prosecutor's office, uh, to become involved in the case.
translation.ko: 그래서 우리 검찰이 수사에 개입하게 됐죠

translation.en: [man 2] Rob Piest was a great all-American kid, 15 years old.
Come from a very stable family, well-liked by everybody,
translation.ko: 안정적인 가정에서 자랐고 주변 모두에게 호감을 사며

translation.en: didn't have any girlfriend problems or any other issues.
translation.ko: 여자 친구 문제나 다른 문제도 없었어요

translation.en: And he had a… a brother and a sister.
Uh, he was the youngest.
translation.ko: "마이클 알브레히트 데스플레인스 경찰서" 삼 남매 중 막내에 가족은 이웃들과 사이가 좋았죠

translation.en: And everybody got along well with that family.
translation.ko: 삼 남매 중 막내에 가족은 이웃들과 사이가 좋았죠

translation.en: [Tovar] The officer that filed the missing persons report
translation.ko: 실종 신고서를 제출한 경관이 약국에 다시 가서

translation.en: went back to the drug store and asked who had been there that night
translation.ko: 실종 신고서를 제출한 경관이 약국에 다시 가서 그날 밤 누가 왔었는지 묻고

translation.en: and incorporated all those names of the people that had been there.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 온 사람들 명단을 만들었는데

translation.en: Among them was John Wayne Gacy's name.
translation.ko: 그중에 존 웨인 게이시의 이름이 있었죠

translation.en: He was there to, uh, get an estimate for a job he wanted to do there at the drugstore.
translation.ko: 약국 공사 견적을 내러 간 거였어요

translation.en: One of the first things we always do, we see who we're dealing with.
translation.ko: 수사의 첫 단계는 용의자를 파악하는 겁니다

translation.en: So we started running the names, checking them for criminal histories.
translation.ko: 그래서 사람들 신상을 조회하고 전과 기록을 확인했죠

translation.en: I think the next-to-last name I checked was Gacy's name.
translation.ko: 끝에서 두 번째로 확인한 게 게이시의 이름일 거예요

translation.en: And we immediately got a hit on him, that he had done time in Iowa for sodomy.
translation.ko: 아이오와에서 남색 죄로 징역을 산 것이 확인됐죠

translation.en: So immediately, that put him at the head of the line
translation.ko: "남색" 그래서 곧바로 주요 용의자로 이름을 올렸죠

translation.en: as far as possible persons of interest.
translation.ko: 그래서 곧바로 주요 용의자로 이름을 올렸죠

translation.en: John Wayne Gacy lived in Norwood Park Township.
It's a Chicago address,
but it's an unincorporated area of Cook County.
[Albrecht] Joseph Kozenczak was Head of Investigations
of the Des Plaines Police Department.
He went out to talk to John Gacy.
[Gacy] Lieutenant Kozenczak, the asshole from Des Plaines Police Department,
translation.ko: 코젠첵 경감, 그 개자식은 데스플레인스 경찰서 소속인데

translation.en: talked to me about the Piest boy disappearance,
asked me if I'd come down and give a witness statement.
I told him I didn't have time, that I'd just had a death in the family,
translation.ko: 집안에 돌아가신 분이 있어서 시간이 없다고 했어요

translation.en: that I'm waiting for a call from my mother in Arkansas.
translation.ko: 아칸소에 계신 어머니의 연락을 기다리고 있다고 했죠

translation.en: So he told Kozenczak he had to take care of his family things,
translation.ko: 존은 코젠첵에게 집안에 일이 있다고 했고

translation.en: and Kozenczak told him it would just be a while, just come out.
He got very aggravated about that.
He said, "You know, Kozenczak has no respect for the dead."
[Gacy] I said, "You're very rude at the time of death."
translation.ko: 코젠첵에게 사람이 죽었는데 너무 무례하다고 했어요

translation.en: And I just told him, you know, "When I got time, I'd get down there."
I said, "I'll come down later." "How much later?"
"I don't know. When I get down there, I'll be down there."
[Tovar] One detective was assigned to watch the house.
translation.ko: 형사 한 명에게 집을 감시하라고 했어요

translation.en: They had seen Gacy arrive in his van.
translation.ko: 형사는 게이시가 밴을 타고 집에 오는 걸 봤어요

translation.en: Well, when the van left, they followed the van,
translation.ko: 밴이 떠나자 형사들은 그 뒤를 미행했죠

translation.en: thinking that Gacy was in it,
when, in fact, it was one of his workers that took the van.
translation.ko: 사실은 직원이 밴을 끌고 나간 거였죠

translation.en: When they finally caught up to it, they realized it wasn't Gacy.
translation.ko: 마침내 밴을 따라잡았을 때 게이시가 아닌 걸 알았지만

translation.en: By that time, Gacy was gone.
[man 3] When Gacy did come into the police station,
he comes in at 3:00 in the morning, everybody's gone.
He's covered with mud. His pants are full of mud.
translation.ko: 진흙투성이가 돼서 왔죠 "그레그 베도 쿡 카운티 형사"

translation.en: His, you know, his shoes are all full of mud.
His car with the back bumper was packed with mud.
translation.ko: 자동차 뒤범퍼도 진흙이 떡칠 돼 있었고

translation.en: There was mud up to the axles. He had mud all over the floorboard.
Uh, and there was nobody there to talk to him. So he left.
translation.ko: 하지만 상대해 줄 사람이 없어서 게이시는 가 버렸죠

translation.en: [Gacy] I drove over to the Des Plaines police station
because I knew they were waiting for me.
[investigator] Who'd you see?
[Gacy] I said, "I'm here to see Lt. Kozenczak." He says, "Oh, he left hours ago."
translation.ko: 코젠첵 경감을 만나러 왔다니까 몇 시간 전에 퇴근했다길래

translation.en: I says, "Well, okay, tell him I'll be back in the morning."
translation.ko: 그럼 아침에 다시 오겠다고 전해 달라고 했어요

translation.en: [Bedoe] But what happened? Why did he get covered with mud?
translation.ko: 하지만 무슨 일이 있었을까요? 왜 진흙 범벅이 됐을까요?

translation.en: How'd he get mud in the car?
[Gacy] I went down to the police station around ten, eleven o'clock in the morning.
They said, "Mr. Kozenczak wants to talk to you."
I said, "All right, I'll wait a few minutes."
11:00 came, 12:00 came, I says, "Look," I says, "I've got to go
'cause I've got things to do."
I don't know what they were waiting for.
[Tovar] They told me to entertain him for a while.
He was not under arrest, we couldn't detain him.
translation.ko: 체포된 게 아니니 가둘 수 없었거든요

translation.en: So I had to use, you know, my imagination on how to keep him there.
translation.ko: 그래서 전 붙잡아 둘 방법을 생각해 내야 했어요

translation.en: I've been a pretty good judge of character,
and I quickly determined this guy had a big ego,
so I just kinda fed on that a little bit.
And a lot of times he was just full of crap, you know.
He was exaggerating his importance, you know, but I didn't care.
translation.ko: 본인이 대단하다고 떠벌리는데 전 신경 안 썼죠

translation.en: All I cared was he was staying there
without me having to force him to stay there.
[Sullivan] So I go over to the little room, introduce myself.
translation.ko: 전 작은 방에 가서 제 소개를 하고 물었어요

translation.en: And I said, uh, "Do you want to give us permission
translation.ko: 전 작은 방에 가서 제 소개를 하고 물었어요 '집을 살펴보는 것을 허락해 주시겠습니까?'

translation.en: to… to go take a look in your house?"
"Since you're telling us you've got nothing to hide."
He said, "No. I'm not gonna give you permission."
I already suspected the guy.
Now the question is, what does he have to hide?
translation.ko: 이제 궁금한 건 과연 뭘 숨기느냐였죠

translation.en: If we're gonna get a search warrant, we'd better get it soon
translation.ko: 수색 영장을 빨리 받는 게 중요했어요

translation.en: so that he doesn't destroy anything that might be there.
translation.ko: 게이시가 집에 있는 것을 훼손하면 안 되니까요

translation.en: [Gacy] Then around 3:30 or 4:30, or I don't know what the hell time it was,
they wanted the keys for my house and that.
"What do you want the keys for my house?"
"We've got a search warrant for your house,
so you either give us the keys or we're gonna kick the door down."
translation.ko: 열쇠를 안 주면 문을 부수겠다고 했어요

translation.en: I said, "I don't have to give you nothing." You know?
translation.ko: 저는 제가 줄 의무는 없다고 했어요

translation.en: But they… they took the keys from me.
[Bedoe] The investigators from Des Plaines,
translation.ko: 데스플레인스 형사들이 수색 영장을 집행했을 때

translation.en: when they executed the search warrant, they were looking for Robert Piest.
translation.ko: 데스플레인스 형사들이 수색 영장을 집행했을 때 목표는 로버트 피스트를 찾는 것이었습니다

translation.en: We were optimistic that maybe he was being held captive.
translation.ko: 로버트가 잡혀 있을지 모른다고 낙관적으로 생각했죠

translation.en: [Tovar] Gacy's house was decorated very eclectic.
translation.ko: 게이시의 집은 매우 다채롭게 꾸며져 있었어요

translation.en: He had a tiki bar there and a pool table.
In the bedrooms, he had pictures of clowns.
They were a little weird.
I think they were more evil than… [chuckles] …than nice clowns, you know, but…
translation.ko: 착한 광대가 아니라 사악한 느낌에 가까웠지만

translation.en: to each his own.
[Tovar] He had an office where he had all sorts of things on his, uh, bulletin board.
translation.ko: 사무 공간의 게시판에는 각종 사항이 다 있었어요

translation.en: But the hallway
going from the front from the kitchen to the back bedrooms was really bizarre.
translation.ko: 현관, 부엌, 뒤쪽 침실까지 이어지는 복도였습니다

translation.en: It was dark brown,
and then it had zigzag lines of yellow paint going to the back.
translation.ko: 노란색 지그재그 선이 뒤까지 이어져 있었죠

Most people nowadays don't know about this,

translation.ko: 그럼 약국에서 봉투에서 뗀 확인증을 주죠

translation.ko: 현관 옷장 안 작은 문을 통해 들어갈 수 있었어요

translation.ko: 그런 질문을 받는 것 자체에 모욕을 느꼈어요

translation.ko: 하지만 게이시가 뭔가 했다는 의심은 있었어요

translation.ko: 밖도 마음껏 돌아다녔고 범죄도 별로 없었어요

I came to Waterloo in 1963

translation.ko: "빌 버거 전 워털루 청년 회의소 회장" 아이오와 대학교 로스쿨을 졸업한 직후

translation.en: and I was, uh, hired into a bank as a trust officer.
translation.ko: 아이오와 대학교 로스쿨을 졸업한 직후 한 은행의 신뢰 업무 전문가로 들어갔고

translation.ko: 곧 워털루 청년 회의소와 연을 맺게 됐죠

translation.en: And within two years, I ran for president.
And, uh, it was during that time that John Gacy came to Waterloo.
translation.ko: 그 시기에 존 게이시가 워털루에 왔죠

translation.en: [Gacy] Moved to Waterloo, Iowa.
I was getting into the Jaycees. I was active in the Jaycees.
[Burger] The Jaycees, during the '60s and '70s and even into the '80s,
was basically an organization of young men 18 to 35.
We did some charitable drives.
[Burger] And it was just a way for somebody that was young to get involved in the community.
[Burger] I was first approached by John Gacy in 1966.
And he just came in to say he was interested in becoming a part of the organization.
translation.ko: 청년 회의소에 관심이 있다며 참여하고 싶다더군요

translation.en: I knew he was married.
[Gacy] Marlynn, we got engaged March 13th of 1964.
We didn't get married until September.
You know, I enjoyed the first two years of my married life.
I was really wrapped into it.
I just had such a nice, warm feeling,

translation.ko: 우리 아이들 마이클, 크리스틴과 있을 때도요

translation.en: It was like being in church all the time.
When we moved up to Iowa,

It was after a year or so with her father, I couldn't handle her father.
translation.ko: 1년 뒤 장인어른과 문제가 생겼죠 감당이 안 됐어요

translation.en: [Burger] When John Gacy came to Waterloo,
it was, uh, to manage these Kentucky Fried Chicken franchises
that, uh, his father-in-law owned.
[Gacy] I could never please my father-in-law.
translation.ko: 난 한 번도 장인어른을 기쁘게 하지 못했어요

translation.en: My father-in-law comes out in the same image as my dad.
I could never do enough for my dad's acceptance.
translation.ko: 내가 열심히 해도 아빠는 알아주지 않았거든요

translation.en: My father-in-law came out the same way.
My dad and I never really got along well while I lived in the house
translation.ko: 아빠와 난 함께 살 때 사이가 좋지 않았어요

translation.en: 'cause I never, I don't know… I guess I… I never lived up to his standards.
translation.ko: 아빠의 기준에서 난 항상 모자랐던 거겠죠

translation.en: [Burger] John was always viewed as pushy. I… I think that's a fair statement.
translation.ko: 존은 늘 강압적이었다고 표현할 수 있을 것 같아요

translation.en: And there were some who didn't like that. There were some who didn't care.
translation.ko: 그걸 싫어하는 사람도 있었고 신경 안 쓰는 사람도 있었죠

translation.en: One particular trait always stood out was
he drove fast everywhere he went.
And nobody liked to ride with him.
I mean, it was like he was headed to a fire every time he got in the car.
translation.ko: 존은 늘 화재 현장에 가듯 차를 몰았어요

translation.en: I don't know where he was headed
and I don't even know if he knew where he was headed,
but it was…
He obviously had some drive.
[man 5] I was 18 years old in 1967.
I was a student at Ellsworth Community College
translation.ko: 아이오와주 아이오와 폴스에 있는 엘즈워스 커뮤니티 칼리지의

translation.en: in Iowa Falls, Iowa.
I rode to school with two other guys that lived in Waterloo.
translation.ko: 워털루에 사는 다른 친구 두 명과 차를 타고 학교에 다녔어요

translation.en: One particular night in January of 1967,
uh, I got picked up at my home.
translation.ko: "스티브 네머스 아이오와 워털루 주민" 집에 있는 저를 친구가 태우러 왔어요

translation.en: And one of those, uh, boys that I went back to school with
translation.ko: 같이 학교로 돌아가던 친구 중 하나가

translation.en: worked at one of the local Kentucky Fried Chicken places.
And he had said he had to stop by the Kentucky Fried Chicken and pick up his check
translation.ko: 자기가 일하는 가게에 들러서 돈부터 받고

translation.en: prior to us driving back to Iowa Falls.
That's when I first met John Gacy.
He seemed very personable, very friendly.

translation.ko: 하지만 당시에 딱히 눈에 띄는 점은 없었어요

John Gacy was telling these two guys that, "Hey, you should come to my house."

translation.ko: 아내와 아들이 시카고에 가서 집이 비었다고요

translation.en: He says, "Why don't you come over to my house and we can play some pool
and… and do some drinking and stuff."
John Gacy's house was just a normal house

translation.ko: 워털루 교외에 흔히 있는 중산층 집이었죠

translation.en: He had a basement that was, uh, fixed up.
It had a… a bar, a built-in bar down there.

We started playing pool, and I was, at the time, a very good pool player,

translation.ko: 어느 순간 게이시가 돈을 걸고 하자길래

translation.ko: 일리노이 주지사 직속 성과 건강 위원회에서 받은 것으로

translation.ko: 자신이 동성애 연구 위원회에 소속돼 있다고 하더군요

There's heterosexual,

translation.ko: 술 취한 친구의 차를 타고 겨울 길을 달리는 건 위험하니까요

translation.en: They left Gacy's house, and we continued to play pool.
translation.ko: 친구들은 떠났고 우리는 계속 포켓볼을 쳤어요

translation.en: John Gacy changed the whole conversation
and looked at me and said, "I have an idea."
translation.ko: 절 보며 좋은 생각이 있다고 했어요

translation.en: "Why don't we play one game for really big stakes?"
translation.ko: '정말 큰 걸 걸고 한 판 칠까?'

translation.ko: '내가 이기면 넌 내게 성행위를 해 주는 거야'

translation.ko: '네가 이기면 내가 너한테 성행위를 해 주고'

translation.ko: 내가 주로 쓰던 방법은 누군가에게 제안해서

translation.en: and if somebody wanted to get into it, then they would pursue the conversation.
translation.ko: 그 사람이 응하면 본론에 들어가는 거였어요

You drop hints or drop seeds and let them come back with the feedback on it.
translation.ko: 암시나 신호를 흘려서 상대의 반응을 보는 거예요

translation.en: And I told him, "No way."
"I'm not gonna have you do a sex act on me,

translation.ko: 내가 해 주는 건 더더욱 싫다고 했죠

translation.ko: 게이시는 영사기를 꺼내서 탁자 위에 설치하고

Pulled up the screen.
He turned on the projector and, uh, left.
And it wasn't… [sighs] …five minutes, probably,

translation.ko: 그래서 진짜 총인 걸 깨달았고 게이시가 제 머리에 겨눈 거였어요

translation.en: And then he told me that he wanted me to take my pants down

I was crying,

translation.ko: 전 경계심이 녹았어요 이제 안전하다고 생각했죠

translation.en: You know, this guy, although he may be an oddball or weird,

"Let's… let's go to bed, and we'll get up first thing in the morning."

translation.ko: 눈을 뜨니까 게이시가 침대 옆에 앉아 있었죠

translation.en: And, uh… [voice catches]
…through the light of the window, I could see his face.
translation.ko: 창밖에서 비치는 빛으로 그자의 얼굴이 보였어요

translation.en: Well, that's a sight I'll… uh, that actually still haunts me to this day.
translation.ko: 지금도 그 모습이 여전히 날 괴롭힙니다

translation.en: [emotionally] And, uh…
the face that I saw that night was, um…
I don't know how to explain it. It was just frightful.
translation.ko: 뭐라 표현할 방법이 없는데 그저 공포스러웠어요

translation.en: He had a knife that was right in the little hole in your throat here.
translation.ko: 여기 목의 움푹한 곳에 칼을 대고 있었어요

translation.en: He was pushing that knife right there.
And rubbing my leg at the same time.
And he told me that we're going to finish what we started in the basement

translation.ko: 아까 지하실에서 심리 실험을 할 때

translation.ko: 짜증이 나서 한 번 더 시도하고 싶었다고요

translation.ko: 전 곧바로 일어나 옷을 입고 6시 30분까지 앉아 있었죠

translation.en: In the morning, I banged on his door and I said, "I'm ready to go."
translation.ko: 날이 밝고 그자의 방문을 두드리며 갈 준비 됐다고 했어요

translation.en: It's about an hour and a half drive to Iowa Falls.
translation.ko: 아이오와 폴스까지는 차로 한 시간 반쯤 걸려요

translation.en: And he said, "Now, Steve, I know that you're upset with me,
translation.ko: 게이시가 말했어요 '스티브, 나한테 화난 거 안다'

I didn't report it to the Waterloo police because I didn't want to discuss it.
translation.ko: 워털루 경찰서에 신고를 안 한 건 그 일을 꺼내기 싫어서였어요

translation.en: I was a young 18-year-old kid and…

translation.ko: 남자 어른이 제게 바지를 내리라고 했고

translation.ko: 제 목에 칼을 들이대고 제 허벅지를 문질렀어요

translation.en: That's… It's not something a young boy wants to talk about.
[Burger] I think I always felt, uh, John was, uh, aggressive
and wanted to advance within the Jaycees.
He was ultimately appointed by one of my successors
translation.ko: 결국에는 제 후임 중 한 명이

translation.en: to be the chaplain for the Waterloo Jaycees,
translation.ko: 워털루 청년 회의소 예배 진행자로 임명했죠

translation.en: which primarily was to give a blessing at when we had meals.
And it was after that that his aspirations to become the president emerged.
translation.ko: 그 후로 게이시가 회장이 되려는 열망을 드러냈죠

translation.en: I guess this was when the rumors started coming out
translation.ko: 그즈음에 소문이 돌기 시작한 것 같아요

translation.en: that John Gacy was not all what he appeared to be.
[Gacy] Long about '67 when I was running for Jaycee President,
translation.ko: 1967년, 내가 청년 회의소 회장직에 출마했을 때

translation.en: I asked Donald Voorhees Sr. to become my campaign manager.
[Burger] Don Voorhees Sr. was a member of the Jaycees.
He then ran for the state legislature
and was elected as a member of the Iowa State Legislature.
[Gacy] In the incident with this Donald Voorhees Jr.,
he was 15 years old.
I think it was in '67,
the summer of '67, or August of '67, or September of '67, somewhere in there.
Donald Voorhees, I was driving from one store to the other,
translation.ko: 도널드 보히즈는… 난 평소대로 가게들을 돌아보고 있었는데

translation.en: which was my daily routine.
Donald Voorhees was hitchhiking. I picked him up.
He was asking me about the stag films.
[Gacy] So me, like… like an asshole, I… I took him over to my house
translation.ko: 그래서 난 짓궂게 도널드를 우리 집으로 데려가서

translation.en: and I showed him the films.
Of course, I got horny by watching 'em.
And anyhow, you know, to cut the conversation short,
what… what happened is that he ended up blowing me,
translation.ko: 결국 도널드는 나한테 입으로 해 줬고

translation.en: and I believe I went down on him.
translation.ko: 결국 도널드는 나한테 입으로 해 줬고 나도 입으로 해 줬죠

translation.en: I had a wife. I had two children. I… I had business. I had wealth.
translation.ko: 난 아내와 자식 둘이 있고 사업으로 부를 쌓았어요

translation.en: Why in the fuck did I go out and get myself involved with a kid?
He told his dad.
Well, his dad turned around and got ahold of the state's attorney,
translation.ko: 이야기를 들은 도널드의 아빠가 주 검사에게 연락했고

translation.en: and then I was, uh, charged with it.
[Burger] Once John was arrested for the assault on Donald Jr.,
it became much more of a topic of conversation in town.
[Gacy] So then I was subsequently indicted for sodomy.
translation.ko: 그리고 난 그 뒤에 남색 혐의로 기소됐죠 "남색 혐의로 게이시를 기소"

translation.en: When I went through the psychiatric evaluation at Iowa City,
I was told I had an anti-social personality,
that it was deemed as an experimental-type thing and that
translation.ko: 그건 실험 타입으로 간주되며 재발하지 않으리라고 생각된다더군요

translation.en: they felt that it would be not a reoccurring thing, and…
that it was-- The whole thing was stupid.
That it should've never happened.
That's why I keep saying instead of being the perpetrator,
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 계속 말하는 거예요 난 가해자가 아니라 피해자였고 이용당한 거라고요

translation.en: I was the victim. I was used.
translation.ko: 난 가해자가 아니라 피해자였고 이용당한 거라고요

translation.en: I was thinking of the kids, and I was thinking of Marlynn,
and I'd never got in trouble before.
translation.ko: 그 전에 문제를 일으킨 적은 한 번도 없었어요

translation.en: And when the pre-sentence report come back that they recommended that…
translation.ko: 판결 전 양형 보고서에 집행 유예를 권고한다고 돼 있었죠

translation.en: I should be given, uh, probation.
And we changed our plea from "not guilty" to "guilty,"
and they set sentencing.
Sentenced me to 10 years, and I nearly dropped.
I could not believe it.
The day after I was sentenced, I was served with divorce papers from Marlynn
translation.ko: 형을 선고받은 다음 날 마를린이 이혼 서류를 내밀었어요

translation.en: on grounds of conviction.
She came there to see me for the last time.
She came to me, and she told me that she had to get a divorce.
That if she didn't get a divorce, her dad was gonna take the kids away from her.
translation.ko: 이혼 안 하면 아버지에게 애들을 뺏길 거라고요

translation.en: [investigator] Now these were your natural children, right?
[Gacy] Right. [clears throat] Right. That's how young they were.
1968, last time I ever seen 'em.
[Sullivan] Gacy was, uh, sentenced to the penitentiary for misusing a young boy.
Wow, did that open our eyes at that particular time.
Now, what do we do with that?
How do we go and keep an eye on Gacy?
Where might he lead us?
[Albrecht] Lieutenant Joe Kozenczak, who was the head of the investigations,
plotted a surveillance on Gacy 24 hours.
So Bob Schultz and Ron Robinson started the noon to midnight.
translation.ko: 그래서 밥 슐츠와 론 로빈슨이 정오부터 자정까지 맡고

translation.en: And Dave Hachmeister was at midnight to noon.
I became his partner, and we were on Gacy from midnight to, uh, to noon,
translation.ko: 전 데이브와 조를 이뤄 자정부터 정오까지

translation.en: wherever he went.
[Sullivan] The police were supposed to be undercover,
but it didn't take him but a day to realize that we were following him.
translation.ko: 게이시는 하루 만에 우리가 미행하는 걸 눈치챘어요

translation.en: At that stage, then we have to try to change our tactics.
translation.ko: 그 단계에서 우리는 전략을 바꿔야 했죠

translation.en: [man 6] And we decided that it would put a lot more psychological pressure on Gacy
translation.ko: 우리는 게이시에게 심리적 압박을 강하게 주기 위해

translation.en: if we did an overt type of surveillance.
And an overt surveillance is where you knock on the individual's door,
translation.ko: 공공연한 감시란 감시 대상의 집에 찾아가서 "론 로빈슨 데스플레인스 경찰서"

translation.en: introduce yourself and tell him that you're the police
translation.ko: "론 로빈슨 데스플레인스 경찰서" 우리가 경찰임을 밝히고

translation.en: and that you're gonna be following him 24 hours a day, seven days a week,
translation.ko: 하루도 안 빼고 24시간 내내 어딜 가든 따라다닐 것을

translation.en: every place that they go.
[Albrecht] The first public place he went into was the Moose Lodge in Des Plaines.
translation.ko: 게이시가 처음 간 공공장소는 데스플레인스의 무스 로지였어요

translation.en: And when Gacy walked in, people just… "John's here!"
translation.ko: 게이시가 들어서자 사람들은 존이 왔다며 소리치며

translation.en: They gravitated towards him. "How you doing, John? Great to see you!"
Kind of the life of the party. That happened quite frequently.
translation.ko: 분위기 메이커 같았고 그런 일이 자주 있었어요

translation.en: [Amirante] He seemed to welcome the investigation.
He welcomed the… the jousting, the back and forth with the police.
[Gacy] Constantly, I was under surveillance.
I could have ditched 'em any one of a number of times and gotten away,
translation.ko: 몇 번이고 경찰을 따돌릴 수 있었지만

translation.en: but I was constantly stopping and trying to help them, you know?
translation.ko: 중간중간 멈춰서 따라올 수 있게 도왔죠

translation.en: They were slowing me down. He said, "Well, goddamn, you never stop."
translation.ko: 경찰은 내 발목만 잡았고 멈출 줄 모른다며 툴툴댔고

translation.en: I said, "Well, I got things to do."
translation.ko: 난 할 일이 있어서 그렇다고 했어요

translation.en: I said, "I got a job going in Aurora, Illinois."
"I've got one in Waukegan, Illinois. I've got three in Chicago."
translation.ko: 일리노이 밀워키에도 한 건 있고 시카고에는 세 건이라고 했죠

translation.en: And I says, "It takes time, and I've got to move around all of them."
translation.ko: 시간이 걸리지만 전부 다녀야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: [Amirante] He was playing a… a cat and mouse game
with the police department, trying to outfox them,
translation.ko: 게이시는 경찰과 술래잡기를 하면서 경찰보다 한발 앞서고

translation.en: trying to manipulate what they were doing,
trying to show that he was in control of this situation.
translation.ko: 상황의 주도권이 자신에게 있음을 보여 주려 했죠

translation.en: [Robinson] One way that John could kinda get even with us for following him
was driving like a maniac.
John would test our driving abilities every day
going up and down side streets.
He would be doing 40, 50 miles an hour on these side streets.
And when we would get on, like, the Kennedy Expressway,
there were many times where, in trying to keep up with John,
we would have to ride on the shoulder of the road,
translation.ko: 고속 도로 안이든 고속 도로 밖이든

translation.en: either on the inside of the Kennedy or the outside of the Kennedy,
just trying to keep up with him.
We're gonna stay with you all the time.
If he went into a coffee shop for coffee,
we went in with John and sat with him and had coffee.
If he went into a bar, we went into the bar with him.
[Albrecht] During these stops at restaurants, we had quite long conversations with Gacy.
translation.ko: 식당에 들렀을 때 게이시와 많은 대화를 나눴어요

translation.en: People started seeing us there all the time with Gacy,
translation.ko: 사람들은 우리가 게이시와 늘 함께 있는 것을 봤고

translation.en: and so Gacy would, uh, describe us as the FBI trying to get some kind of drug case on him.
translation.ko: 게이시는 우리가 마약 사건을 조사 중인 FBI라고 했죠

translation.en: A couple places he went, he described us as his bodyguards.
But he also told us that he had hired people to follow us
translation.ko: 사람을 고용해 우리를 미행하게 했다고도 했어요

translation.en: to watch us,
and if he gave the sign, they were gonna take us out.
translation.ko: 자기가 신호를 주면 우리를 처리할 거라더군요

translation.en: So, uh, we were aware that Gacy was full of himself.
translation.ko: 그래서 자기애가 넘치는 인간인 걸 알고 있었어요

translation.en: One time, he told us that he had heard
that Rob Piest was found up in, uh, Wisconsin and he was all right.
translation.ko: 로버트 피스트가 위스콘신에서 목격됐고 무사하다고 했어요

translation.en: [Byers-Lund] Rob would never run away.
There was something wrong.
The police came to visit me at school with the Piest family
translation.ko: 경찰이 로버트의 가족과 함께 학교에 절 찾아와서

translation.en: to see, you know, what did Rob say and, um, where was he going.
translation.ko: 로버트가 뭐라고 했고 어디로 갔는지 물었어요

translation.en: And I explained that Rob said he was going outside
translation.ko: 전 롭이 건설업자와 일자리 이야기를 하러

translation.en: to talk to the contractor about a job.
They told me later that the contractor denied all that,
translation.ko: 나중에 경찰 말이 그 건설업자가 다 부인했다더군요

translation.en: that I was lying, and he never talked to that boy about getting a job.
translation.ko: 제 말이 거짓말이고 일자리 얘기 한 적 없다고요

translation.en: I was so angry 'cause I never lie.
translation.ko: 너무나 화가 났어요 전 절대 거짓말하지 않거든요

translation.en: [Bedoe] I was working with the Des Plaines police, but I wasn't a member.
translation.ko: 전 데스플레인스 경찰과 일했지만 거기 소속은 아니었어요

translation.en: I was the investigator with the Cook County Sheriff's Dept.
assigned to the State's Attorney's office.
I was like an in-between guy.
Fortunately, I could do whatever I wanted to, uh, most of the time
translation.ko: 운 좋게도 제 위치 덕분에 대부분 시간 동안

translation.en: because of my position.
translation.ko: 하고 싶은 것을 할 수 있었어요

translation.en: If something needed to be investigated, I did it.
translation.ko: 수사가 필요한 일이 있다 하면 제가 했죠

translation.en: I didn't have to get permission from anybody. I just went out and did it.
translation.ko: 허가받을 필요 없이 제가 하면 됐어요 "존 W. 게이시 일리노이에서 가석방"

translation.en: We looked at his rap sheet. He had other arrests.
translation.ko: 게이시의 전과 기록을 봤는데 다른 체포 기록은 있었지만

translation.en: But they didn't jump off the rap sheet as being sexually related.
A lot of times, they were, like, disorderly conduct or battery or whatever.
translation.ko: 대부분 풍기 문란이나 폭행 같은 것들이었죠

translation.en: You know, they didn't really go into the detail of he was soliciting a kid for sex.
translation.ko: 성행위를 위해 아동을 꼬드겼다는 자세한 내용 같은 건 없었습니다

translation.en: You know, those details weren't there.
[Amirante] Gacy was part of that powerful Democratic Party.
You don't think a phone call could have been made to the local police department,
translation.ko: 지금은 상상할 수 없지만 경찰서에 전화가 와서

translation.en: saying, "Leave this guy alone. He's, uh, a decent… He's a good guy."
translation.ko: 게이시는 좋은 사람이니까 내버려 두라고 했어요

translation.en: "He's a good guy." And that's how Cook County used to work back then.
translation.ko: 게이시는 좋은 사람이니까 내버려 두라고 했어요 당시 쿡 카운티는 그렇게 돌아갔죠

translation.en: And, you know, people were looking down at… at gay kids at the time, gay young men.
You think the police were about to listen to the gay guy that came in
and… and beefed about Gacy, who everybody knew,
and, you know, he was… he was friends with everybody?
[Tovar] Gacy's choice for workers was always young men,
translation.ko: 게이시는 직원으로 늘 어린 사람을 뽑았어요

translation.en: small in stature,
usually light-colored hair.
[Amirante] The two main guys that we encountered was Mike Rossi
translation.ko: 우리가 접한 주요 인물 두 명은 마이클 로시와

translation.en: and David Cram.
Michael Rossi and David Cram were Gacy's assistants
translation.ko: 마이클 로시와 데이비드 크램은 게이시의 조수로

translation.en: at PDM Contractors
who worked very closely with him in everything he did.
translation.ko: 게이시와 모든 일을 함께 하는 측근이었죠

translation.en: But they were basically his little…
They were gofers, and they would help him running the business,
they'd help him run his business.
[Sullivan] As we're going through the investigation
and we talk to people and find out that,
translation.ko: 사람들과 이야기하면서 알게 된 게 있었어요

translation.en: "Yeah, there's a kid by the name of such-and-such."
"He worked for Gacy at a time. I haven't seen him in a while."
translation.ko: '게이시의 회사에서 일했는데 안 보인 지 한참 됐어요'

translation.en: And then we got, uh… people started coming… coming forward, saying,
you know, "I know this guy. He worked there. He's missing too."
translation.ko: '이 사람 알아요, 거기서 일했는데 이 사람도 실종됐어요'

translation.en: Gregory Godzik was a Chicago boy.
He had worked for Gacy,
and, uh, he turned up missing.
[Bedoe] And then, we… we find out that another kid that used to work for Gacy, he's up and disappeared.
translation.ko: 그리고 게이시 밑에서 일하다가 실종된 소년을 또 찾았어요

translation.en: John Butkovich one day didn't show up for work. Nobody ever saw him again.
translation.ko: 존 버트코비치는 어느 날 결근했고 다시는 본 사람이 없었죠

translation.en: The police came by asking questions. You know, nothing.
Gacy denied knowing anything about the kid's disappearance.
translation.ko: 게이시는 실종에 관해 아는 게 없다고 부정했죠

translation.en: [Tovar] The class ring that had the initials JS
translation.ko: 수색 영장을 받아 게이시의 집에서 발견한

translation.en: that we found in Gacy's house during the search warrant
translation.ko: 이니셜 JS가 새겨진 졸업 기념 반지는

translation.en: turned out to belong to a young man named John Szyc.
And had lived in Des Plaines, but, uh, had moved into the city.
Uh, we contacted his parents,
and his mother told us that he had been missing for a while.
translation.ko: 아들이 실종된 지 오래됐다고 어머니가 말했어요

translation.en: [Bedoe] John Szyc's car was never recovered when he disappeared.
translation.ko: 존 지크가 실종됐을 때 자동차가 발견되지 않았어요

translation.en: And then, during the course of the investigation,
when I got the information from Szyc's parents what car he'd been driving,
translation.ko: 지크의 부모에게 차에 관한 정보를 들었는데

translation.en: one of the guys, might've been Tovar said,
"That's the same kind of car that Mike Rossi's driving."
The VIN number was altered.
And then Gacy sold it to Rossi for, you know, pennies on the dollar.
[Robinson] That put John in contact, or knowing, four or five different people
translation.ko: 그렇게 존과 관계있거나 아는 사람 네댓 명이

translation.en: who had come up missing that had never been located.
This is highly unusual.
I mean, most people don't know any missing peop… person,
translation.ko: 보통 사람들은 실종자를 한 명도 모르는데

translation.en: let alone coming to know four or five.
[Sullivan] All of these things were going on at the same time.
translation.ko: 이 모든 게 동시에 벌어지고 있었어요

translation.en: We were suspecting a bad outcome.
But we also knew that we didn't have any bodies.
translation.ko: 하지만 시체가 한 구도 발견되지 않았어요

translation.en: [Bedoe] Why are these people vanishing, never to be found or seen again?
translation.ko: 왜 이 사람들은 사라져서 발견되거나 목격되지 않을까요?

translation.en: Bodies never discovered.
You're scratching your head, you're going, "What happened? They just vanished."
"Never turned up. Where did they go?"
[Sullivan] You know, "When does this end? What have we got here?"
translation.ko: '이 사건의 끝은 뭔가? 우리가 알아낸 것은 뭔가?'

translation.en: 'Cause truly, we didn't know.
[Bedoe] The scary part was that his attorneys had run down to the federal court
translation.ko: 무서운 건 게이시의 변호사가 연방 법원으로 달려가

translation.en: and applied for a federal injunction against the State's Attorney's office
and the Des Plaines Police Department.
[Amirante] Leroy Stevens,
translation.ko: "리로이 스티븐스 게이시의 민사 변호사" 당시 저는 게이시 회사의 민사 변호사 리로이 스티븐스와

translation.en: who was his civil lawyer for his company at the time, and I
translation.ko: 당시 저는 게이시 회사의 민사 변호사 리로이 스티븐스와

translation.en: were in the midst of preparing a federal lawsuit
against the Des Plaines Police Department
um, to enjoin them from, uh, harassing Gacy.
And really ruining his business
translation.ko: 경찰의 과도한 미행으로 사업에 큰 지장이 있었고

translation.en: because they were following him so closely and violating his civil rights.
translation.ko: 경찰의 과도한 미행으로 사업에 큰 지장이 있었고 인권을 침해당하고 있었으니까요

translation.en: Terry Sullivan, who was the prosecutor, was playing it close to the vest.
translation.ko: 테리 설리번 검사는 패를 드러내지 않았고

translation.en: The police department was playing it close to the vest. We couldn't get information.
translation.ko: 경찰 역시 마찬가지라 우린 정보를 얻을 수 없었어요

translation.en: The only way we'd get to the bottom of it was file the lawsuit.
[Bedoe] If he gets that injunction approved, that's the end of it.
We'd have to back off altogether.
Can't interview him, his employees, nothing.
So yeah, time was of the essence. There's no question about it.
[Amirante] You have to understand that, at the time,
Leroy and I really truly believed Gacy was innocent.
translation.ko: 리로이와 저는 게이시의 결백을 철석같이 믿었어요

translation.en: Terry Sullivan eventually told me about the case that John had in Iowa,
translation.ko: 테리 설리번은 결국 아이오와에서 존이 일으킨 사건을 제게 말해 줬어요

translation.en: which was a sodomy case, which, you know, I was shocked that he had that
'cause no… who expected Gacy, this guy who was the precinct captain,
to have been convicted of sodomy? Nobody knew that.
[Gacy] I was sentenced to Fort Madison, Iowa, which was a penitentiary,
but then they revised it and said
that since I was a first offender and I was still under 26,
that I should be sent to the men's reformatory at Anamosa.
I was sent there. I was scared to death.
Again, never being arrested before,
never being in jail before, didn't know what the hell…
translation.ko: 감옥도 처음인지라 어떤 곳인지 전혀 몰랐죠

translation.en: I thought I was gonna get killed in there. [male choir sings] ♪ O come let us adore him ♪
♪ O come let us adore him ♪
♪ O come let us adore him ♪
…I got into it and organized myself.
I went in there with a positive attitude.
And, uh, I became not only popular, but powerful.
Hello, I'm John Gacy. I'm from Waterloo, Iowa.
translation.ko: 안녕하세요, 전 존 게이시고 아이오와 워털루에서 왔습니다

translation.en: [man 7] And you're a man of some authority here. What's your title?
Well, I'm first cook in the kitchen,
and I run the, uh, the morning meal and the afternoon meal in the kitchen.
Food was a… was an avenue of power
is… is I guess that's how I would describe it,
translation.ko: 음식은 권력의 수단이었어요 권력의 수단이라는 표현이 적합해요

translation.en: would be an avenue of power.
And John used it relentlessly.
translation.ko: 존은 그 권력을 가차 없이 휘둘렀죠

translation.en: Screw with John Gacy
and you better start taking your meals somewhere else
translation.ko: 다른 곳에서 밥을 구하는 게 좋아요

translation.en: because you had to assume that you're gonna get something like,
for lack of a better description,
mouse turds in your… in your food the next time you come through
because you didn't do what he said.
[Gacy] Without force, I controlled the kitchen,
translation.ko: 난 무력을 쓰지 않고 주방을 지휘했어요

translation.en: and there was some 55 inmates in the kitchen.
But I never yield to anybody.
translation.ko: 하지만 난 한 번도 고함친 적 없어요

translation.en: [Cornell] The other thing, of course, was the… the Jaycees,
translation.ko: 다른 걸 꼽자면 당연히 청년 회의소죠

translation.en: and that's how I met him.
I'm sitting there reading or something,
and he said, "Hi, I'm John Gacy, and, uh, I'm recruiting for the Jaycees."
translation.ko: 존이 와서 인사하며 청년 회의소 회원을 모집한다는데

translation.en: I didn't even know what the hell the Jaycees was at that point.
translation.ko: 당시 저는 청년 회의소가 뭔지도 몰랐어요

translation.en: By halfway through the time that we were there,
translation.ko: 하지만 우리가 형을 절반쯤 살았을 때

translation.en: say toward the end of 1969,
that was one of the largest Jaycee chapters
in the entire state of Iowa,
largely due to the recruiting efforts of John Gacy.
translation.ko: 존 게이시가 회원 모집에 공들인 덕이 컸죠

translation.en: …at the Anamosa Men's Reformatory.
translation.ko: 난 애나모사 소년원에서 올해의 인물로 뽑혔어요

translation.en: I built the first miniature golf course inside the walls of a reformatory.
translation.ko: 소년원 안에 처음으로 미니 골프장을 만들었죠

translation.en: [Cornell] This is an example of the man's abilities and talent.
translation.ko: 존의 능력과 재능을 보여 주는 예입니다

translation.en: I think you could make a case that there was a good John and a bad John.
translation.ko: 착한 존과 나쁜 존이 있다고 할 수 있을 거예요

translation.en: I knew the good John.
I had glimpses of other things.
[Gacy] The weak do not survive in prison.
You either come under, uh, the ruling of… of some gang or… or some other forceful inmate.
You do what he says, otherwise you get the shit kicked out of you.
translation.ko: 시키는 대로 하지 않으면 두들겨 맞죠

translation.en: Well, I would not bow to any of that shit
because nobody will ever lead me.
translation.ko: 내 앞에 설 사람은 아무도 없으니까

translation.en: He was walking on the range that he lived in, over in the south house,
translation.ko: 존이 자기가 지내던 남쪽 생활관을 지나다가

translation.en: and he saw one inmate performing fellatio on another inmate in a cell,
translation.ko: 감방에서 재소자끼리 펠라티오를 하는 것을 보고

translation.en: and just simply walked over, and kicked the guy in the face four times,
translation.ko: 그대로 들어가 얼굴을 네 번이나 걷어차서

translation.en: and basically broke his jaw.
He's struggling with his sexual urges toward homosexuals.
translation.ko: 존은 동성애 성욕 때문에 힘들어 했습니다

translation.en: That came out in his, in my opinion…
That came out in his personality as anger, as rage.
translation.ko: 그것이 성격적인 부분에서 화와 분노로 표출됐죠

translation.en: [man 7] How long have you been here?
I've been here now a year and about two weeks.
[man 7] You mind my asking how long do you plan to take up residence here?
translation.ko: 이곳에서 얼마나 더 지낼 생각인지 물어봐도 될까요?

translation.en: Well, I hope to be getting out sometime in May.
[man 7] Well, good. Yes. You gonna continue as a cook, use that as a profession, do you think?
translation.ko: 그렇군요, 나가서도 요리를 업으로 할 건가요?

translation.en: Right. This is my profession before I came in.
translation.ko: 네, 들어오기 전에도 요리 일을 했거든요

translation.en: -[man 7] All right. -Food service.
[Cornell] It was Christmastime.
We were deeply involved in the Toys for Tots project.
translation.ko: 우린 불우 아동 장난감 기부 프로젝트와

translation.en: We were deeply involved with the Christmas banquet for the Jaycees.
translation.ko: 청년 회의소 크리스마스 만찬을 열심히 준비했죠

translation.en: A lot was going on.
But then, John's… [clears throat]
…John's father died.
[Gacy] December 18th, my dad went in the hospital in Chicago
and I was never told of it.
My dad died December 25th, Christmas Day.
They didn't tell me until after my dad was buried that he died.
translation.ko: 아빠가 돌아가신 사실을 장례식이 끝난 뒤에야 들었어요

translation.en: Even after going to the joint for… for this sodomy conviction and all that,
translation.ko: 존이 남색 죄로 감옥에 오고 나서도

translation.en: his father was still alive.
John had the option at some point in time of trying to mend that fence.
But not after that.
It was over. It was done.
I don't recall ever hearing him laugh very much after that.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 한동안 존이 웃는 걸 들은 기억이 없어요

translation.en: [Gacy] What I'm doing is just telling what my dad always told me, is I'm weak.
translation.ko: 아빠가 늘 내게 했던 말은 내가 약하다는 거예요

translation.en: Just a dumb, stupid kid. Can't do nothing.
translation.ko: 멍청한 바보고 할 줄 아는 게 없다고요

translation.en: Yeah, he was right about a lot of things. I let him down when he died.
translation.ko: 아빠 말에 옳은 부분이 많았어요 돌아가실 때도 실망시켰죠

translation.en: [Cornell] Most of the people who were serving ten-year sentences
would serve around two years.
But because of who we were and what we did inside,
translation.ko: 하지만 우리는 소년원에 이바지한 바가 있어서

translation.en: John and I got out in 18 months.
So he and I basically left, uh, that, uh, second week in July,
and, uh, we shook hands and walked away.
[Robinson] By being with John everywhere all the time,
we were trying to break him down.
I mean, I think that you can be the most law-abiding citizen in the entire world
translation.ko: 세상에서 가장 훌륭한 준법 시민이라 해도

translation.en: and you still would not want the police to be following you
24 hours a day, seven days a week.
[Albrecht] As it went along
and the investigators were interviewing Gacy contacts, Gacy's friends,
I think some friends started realizing there's something more to this.
translation.ko: 친구 중 일부는 심상치 않다는 걸 깨달았던 것 같아요

translation.en: I feel we were all that Gacy had left to talk to.
translation.ko: 게이시가 대화할 사람은 우리밖에 없었을 겁니다

translation.en: Nobody else wanted much to do with him.
[Robinson] In some ways, I think John began to think that we were his best friends.
translation.ko: 어떤 면에서 존은 우리를 절친한 친구로 보기 시작했어요

translation.en: We weren't giving him a hard time, only following him.
translation.ko: 우린 존을 괴롭히지 않고 따라다니기만 했거든요

translation.en: [Robinson] Many times, he invited us in, trying to show what a nice guy he was
translation.ko: 존은 자기가 좋은 사람이며 우호적이란 걸 보여 주려고

translation.en: and how amiable he was with us, and it got us into the house.
translation.ko: 우리를 자주 초대했고 덕분에 우린 집에 들어갔죠

translation.en: We had gotten a request from Lieutenant Kozenczak.
translation.ko: 코젠첵 경감이 우리에게 부탁한 게 있었어요

translation.en: There were a missing TV and a missing radio from a missing person.
translation.ko: 실종자 중에 TV와 라디오가 없어진 사람이 있었어요

translation.en: [Tovar] John Szyc's mother told us
translation.ko: 존 지크의 어머니가 말하길 아들 방에 작은 TV가 있었는데

translation.en: that a little TV that he had in his bedroom
was missing from his house.
She described it as a Motorola type TV,
and we recalled having seen a TV similar to that
translation.ko: 수색 영장을 받아 게이시의 집에 들어갔을 때

translation.en: when we went into Gacy's house during the search warrant.
translation.ko: 그 비슷한 TV를 본 기억이 있었어요

translation.en: So Bob Schultz said he had to use the restroom,
which would get him into the other part of the house where he could search.
translation.ko: 자리를 뜬 후 다른 쪽으로 가서 살펴봤어요

translation.en: My job became then to keep John entertained
translation.ko: 제가 할 일은 존의 관심을 끌어서

translation.en: so he didn't go looking for Bob.
translation.ko: 존이 밥을 찾지 않게 하는 거였죠

translation.en: Bob looked around, couldn't find the TV.
translation.ko: 밥은 집을 둘러봤지만 TV를 찾지 못했어요

translation.en: So he's in the bathroom,
flushin' the toilet like a good guy should. [laughs]
But then, the heat kicked on.
And that made all the difference in the world
because Bob was right there by the heating duct, and this came up,
translation.ko: 밥이 히터 배관 바로 옆에 있었는데

translation.en: and he got a whiff of that like you wouldn't believe.
And right away, he thought, "A putrid odor?"
translation.ko: 밥은 곧바로 뭔가 썩는 냄새라고 생각했고

translation.en: Yes, it was.
We've been on the job for too long, we've handled too many dead bodies.
translation.ko: 우리는 경찰 생활을 오래 하며 수많은 시체를 다뤘어요

translation.en: If he says that's what it was, you can take it to the bank.
translation.ko: 밥이 그렇다고 하면 의심할 여지가 없죠

translation.en: Schultz recognized an odor that he knew was decomposing flesh.
translation.ko: 슐츠는 살점이 부패하는 냄새인 걸 알아챘어요

translation.en: A body, a dead body.
Anyway, he comes back at the end of his shift and tells me about the smell.
translation.ko: 슐츠는 근무를 교대하려고 돌아와 제게 냄새 이야기를 해 줬죠

translation.en: Well at the same time, I was hell-bent on trying to find a way
to get underneath Gacy's skin
to… to make him lose his temper and slip up and make a mistake.
translation.ko: 이성을 잃게 해 실수를 유도할 작정이었어요

translation.en: Say something, you know, that would be incriminating.
David Cram worked for him, for his company PDM.
I said, "Let's get Cram back in here for an interview."
translation.ko: 전 크램을 다시 데려와서 면담을 하자고 했죠

translation.en: "Drag him back. Let's talk to him some more."
translation.ko: 크램을 다시 끌고 와서 불게 하자고요

translation.en: So, I'm talking to Cram, and I said to him,
"Did you ever see Gacy completely lose his temper?"
translation.ko: 게이시가 폭발하는 걸 본 적 있느냐고요

translation.en: He says, "Yeah." I say, "What… what was the circumstance?"
He says, "Well, Gacy had me digging in the crawl space."
translation.ko: 게이시의 지시로 바닥 밑 공간을 판 적 있다더군요

translation.en: And he says, "I changed directions."
"Instead of going on a straight line, I went on a diagonal."
"Gacy came down to check on what I was doing, how I was digging."
"He saw a diagonal instead of a straight line, he completely lost his temper."
translation.ko: 직선이 아니라 대각선인 걸 보고 폭발했다고 하더라고요

translation.en: Swearing, jumping up and down, hollering, screaming,
"Goddamn it, I told you. I want you to dig here, not here."
And that's what got me thinking, the whole time we were doing this,
translation.ko: 그때 생각이 들었어요 내내 우리가 조사하고

translation.en: we're trying to figure out where these people went.
Where are they?
And, you know, in my wildest dreams, I say, "It can't possibly be,"
translation.ko: 전 꿈에서도 그럴 리 없다고 생각했는데

translation.en: but then you hear a story,
and then you go, "Is it possible that there's somebody down there?"
translation.ko: 누가 그곳에 있지 않을까 생각이 들더군요

translation.en: So I, that… with that, I had, um…
my mission was… [laughs] …was to get Terry Sullivan to give us a second search warrant,
translation.ko: 테리 설리번에게 두 번째 수색 영장을 요청했어요

translation.en: which is not usual.
Two search warrants on the same property.
translation.ko: 같은 장소로 수색 영장을 두 번 받다니

translation.en: That was crazy. Come on. We gotta get this second search warrant.
translation.ko: 말이 안 되는 일이지만 수색 영장을 받아야 했어요

translation.en: "We need the second search warrant!" Terry says, "You can't."
translation.ko: 수색 영장을 한 번 더 내달라니까 테리가 안 된다고 했고

translation.en: I said, "We gotta… Figure it out! You're the lawyer!"
translation.ko: 전 당신이 검사니까 어떻게든 달라고 했어요

translation.en: [Sullivan] What we needed during those days was evidence.
We needed to hook the evidence onto Gacy so it wouldn't fall off.
translation.ko: 게이시가 빠져나갈 수 없는 증거가 필요했죠

translation.en: [Byers-Lund] "I came home after school to get something to eat before I went shopping."
translation.ko: '학교를 마치고 쇼핑 가기 전에 뭘 먹으려고 집에 왔다'

translation.en: "The phone rang, they asked me questions about the film slip."
translation.ko: '전화기가 울렸고 경찰이 인화 영수증에 관해 물었다'

translation.en: The night that Rob went missing,
I was, um, handing in some film to be processed at the pharmacy.
translation.ko: 전 약국에 인화할 필름을 넘기고 있었어요

translation.en: And I filled out my envelope,
and I put it in the pack that was to be picked up.
And I tore off the receipt,
and then I put the receipt in the little trash box that was near the side of the cash register.
translation.ko: 계산대 옆에 있던 작은 쓰레기통에 넣었죠

translation.en: And then, um, I just kind of stopped.
And then, I stared at that receipt, and it stared back at me.
And for an unknown reason,
I grabbed the receipt and I stuck it in Rob's jacket pocket.
translation.ko: 저도 모르게 영수증을 꺼내서 로버트의 재킷 주머니에 넣었죠

translation.en: [Sullivan] Thank God Kim Byers had put that little receipt
into her pocket,
which turns out to be Rob's coat.
[Byers-Lund] Those are those hunches, or intuitions,
whatever you wanna call them.
They drive us to do things that we're not sure why we do.
translation.ko: 그것은 우리가 이유도 모른 채 뭔가 하게 만들죠

translation.en: I call them "God whispers,"
where someone guides you to do something.
translation.ko: 뭔가 하도록 어떤 존재가 이끄는 거예요

translation.en: [Tovar] That receipt wound up in the trash at John Wayne Gacy's house.
translation.ko: 그 영수증이 존 게이시의 집 쓰레기통에서 나왔어요

translation.en: And that was our first connection putting Robert in that house.
translation.ko: 로버트와 그 집을 연결 짓는 최초의 단서였죠

translation.en: [Sullivan] We had it sent out to the crime lab
translation.ko: 그 영수증을 과학 수사 연구소에 보내서

translation.en: to see if they could match it up
to the envelope of developed film.
And, in fact, there was a match,
exactly how it was torn off
and the different little pieces and angles that were still in there.
translation.ko: 작은 부분들과 기울기가 그대로 남아 있었는데

translation.en: Wow, it perfectly matched.
We were, of course, very happy 'cause that looks really good in court.
translation.ko: 재판에서 유리한 증거가 될 테니 우린 무척 기뻤습니다

translation.en: [Bedoe] The receipt for the film from Kim Byers, plus the smell,
translation.ko: 킴 바이어스가 챙긴 필름 영수증과 그 악취까지 더하니

translation.en: that was enough for Terry to say okay,
and he drew up a second warrant.
[Robinson] We had a lot of heat on him at this time,
translation.ko: "로버트 피스트 사건 수사 9일 차 1978년 12월 20일" 이번엔 게이시를 강하게 몰아붙였고

translation.en: and we could tell from John's deportment that he could feel the pressure too.
translation.ko: 압박감을 심하게 느낀다는 것을 게이시의 행동에서 알 수 있었죠

translation.en: [Amirante] The net was kind of closing in on him. The web was closing in on him at the time.
translation.ko: 수사망이 좁혀 들고 있었어요 점점 조여들고 있었죠

translation.en: His cat and mouse game was coming to an end.
[Tovar] I think we started noticing that something was happening to him,
translation.ko: 게이시에게 뭔가 일어나고 있다는 낌새가 느껴졌고

translation.en: which eventually did.
He finally just kinda went off the rails a little bit.
[Amirante] John Gacy called me, wanted to get together
because he told me that he had something new
to tell me and Leroy Stevens.
And I told him, "John, if it's something new, fine."
"Otherwise, I don't wanna hear the same old bullshit from you."
translation.ko: 아니라면 똑같은 헛소리는 듣기 싫다고 했어요

translation.en: [Gacy] Rationally and understandably,
I went over to talk to Sam about the harassment,
translation.ko: 난 샘에게 괴롭힘에 관해 말하러 갔어요

translation.en: not of me,
but why they were harassing my employees.
Why was I defending them?
Was I afraid they were gonna say something about what I was doing?
translation.ko: 직원들이 내가 뭔가 했다고 말할까 봐 무서워서요?

translation.en: He came and told me the same old story,
vehemently denying anything to do with this kid.
translation.ko: 피해자와 아무 관계 없다고 열변을 토했죠

translation.en: I… I didn't believe him anymore. I really did not believe him.
translation.ko: 전 더 이상 존을 믿지 않았어요

translation.en: I had a picture of Robbie Piest
that was on the front page of the Daily Herald,
the suburban news daily out there.
I started pounding on the table. I said… I said, "Look at this, Gacy! Look at this, John!"
translation.ko: 전 탁자를 내리치며 말했어요 '이것 좀 보라고요, 존!'

translation.en: "This kid is missing! They think you did it!"
translation.ko: '이 아이가 실종됐고 경찰은 당신 짓이라고 생각해요!'

translation.en: "Stop lying to me!"
I yelled at him like that. I pounded the thing.
And he got very sheepish, and he said, "Do you have anything to drink here?"
translation.ko: 존은 매우 당황하더니 술 있느냐고 묻더군요

translation.en: I poured a little vino for me, a little bit for Gacy, little bit for Stevens.
translation.ko: 전 와인을 따서 저와 게이시, 스티븐스에게 따랐고

translation.en: We each drank a shot of it.
And Gacy said, "Fill up my cup."
translation.ko: 게이시는 한 잔 더 달라고 했고

translation.en: And I filled his cup up,
and he just chugged it down, chugged it down.
He looks at the picture of Robbie Piest, he goes, um… [clicks tongue]
"This boy is dead." Just like that.
My heart…
My heart start… boom-boom… started pounding.
It was just…
I'm like, "What? What am I getting into here?"
Then he says… And Leroy and I are just sitting here watching him, and he goes,
translation.ko: 리로이와 제가 빤히 보고 있으니 말하더군요

translation.en: "I've been a judge, jury, and executioner of many, many people."
Now I wanna be my own judge, jury, and executioner."
"I wanna tell you everything that happened."
[Amirante] I aged many, many years during that night, uh,
both as a lawyer, uh, and as a person.
It was one of the scariest nights of my life.
translation.ko: 제 생애 가장 무서운 밤 중 하나였어요

translation.en: My heart was pounding out of my chest the rest of the night,
s-smoking one cigarette after another one.
Leroy was smoking. He turned…
He… he lit his cigarettes backwards. The filter was on the wrong end.
And after he told us all this…
he, um… he fell asleep.
[Gacy] I don't remember exactly what happened.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있었는지 정확하게 기억 안 나요

translation.en: I can remember I went to Sam's office,
but I did not go to Sam's office to tell him all that shit.
Evidently, when I got there…
something else took over and some other conversation come up.
translation.ko: 생각이 바뀌어서 다른 얘기가 나온 거죠

translation.en: It was a horrible, professional, ethical spot for me as a young lawyer.
translation.ko: 젊은 변호사로서 끔찍하고 전문적이며 윤리적인 자리였어요

translation.en: I was 30 years old.
And, uh, Leroy, you know, we had to figure…
The best thing to do is get him to a psychiatrist, have him committed,
and then figure out what to do with this guy.
translation.ko: 어떻게 할지 대책을 세우는 게 최선이었어요

translation.en: So we set up an appointment
for, like, eight o'cl… eight, nine o'clock in the morning
with the psychiatrist we found during the night.
[Albrecht] My partner and I started that night
translation.ko: 그날 밤 제 파트너와 근무를 시작한 곳은

translation.en: at Gacy's attorney, Sam Amirante's, office in Park Ridge, downtown Park Ridge.
translation.ko: 파크리지 시내에 있는 게이시의 변호사 사무실이었어요

translation.en: So just as I got to the building,
Sam Amirante and his other attorney, Leroy Stevens,
were coming out of his office
and into the vestibule, the whole building there,
and they invited us in.
And they couldn't be nice enough to us. They cou…
"You want a bottle of booze? Want anything to eat?" Um…
"Whatever you want, we'll get for you. You can't let Gacy go."
translation.ko: 말만 하면 다 주겠다면서 게이시를 놓치면 안 된다더군요

translation.en: "If he tries to leave,
translation.ko: 게이시가 가려고 하면 차 타이어라도 쏴서

translation.en: you gotta shoot his tires out, and don't let him leave."
translation.ko: 게이시가 가려고 하면 차 타이어라도 쏴서 가는 걸 막아야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: "You can't let him leave."
Finally, we said, "Sam, we're not gonna shoot somebody's tires out."
translation.ko: 우린 남의 차 타이어를 쏘지 않을 거라고 했어요

translation.en: "Unless, why? Why should we be taking this kind of activity?"
translation.ko: 왜 그런 짓을 해야 하냐고 물었죠

translation.en: "Just do what you can."
"I can't tell you now, but you… you can't let him go."
translation.ko: 당장 말해 줄 순 없지만 절대 보내면 안 된다고 했어요

translation.en: [Amirante] About six in the morning, it started to get light.
Gacy starts waking up. He goes, "What am I doing here?" You know…
translation.ko: 게이시가 깨더니 자기가 왜 여기 있느냐더군요

translation.en: "What… I got things to do. I got places to go today. I'm… I'm really busy."
translation.ko: 할 일이 있고 갈 데도 있어서 바쁘다고 했어요

translation.en: I said, "John, you told me everything. You were here all night."
translation.ko: 전 당신이 전부 말했고 밤새 여기 있었다고 했어요

translation.en: "Leroy and I, you talked to us, you told us the whole thing."
"Well, I can't talk about that. I got places to go, things to do."
translation.ko: 게이시는 바쁘다고 그런 말 할 때가 아니라며

translation.en: "I'm outta here." Pew…
Takes off.
